page.title: 03Scaleby Parish Council
page.content: There are eight members of Scaleby Parish Council who are elected by the villagers. Mrs. E. Watson of Summer Hill, Scaleby Hill is the Clerk to the Council; she has had this job for 11 years. The Council meets four times a year to discuss any matters suggested by the members and use of the Parish Hall, upkeep of roads and planning. There is little new building being allowed in Scaleby as there is no main drainage. Scaleby Parish Council is also responsible for footpaths and rights of way and for the preservation of wildlife on{Scaleby Moss.}It shares this responsibility with{Blackford {Parish Council.}({Scaleby Moss}is in the adjacent block 03400561). Mrs. Watson is paid Â£50 a year as Clerk to the Council.
